intro: Verbesina strigulosa, commonly known as rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and rough, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Verbesina strigulosa is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it thrives in sunny environments.
